result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel R Pugh

records.addlTxt:
09:44 AM Defendant Joel R Pugh in court with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. Victim(s) appear in court in person. 

Judge Carter is covering hearing for Judge Dorow. 

Atty Jensen did receive global offer from the State last week, and requests another date to send a counter offer to the State and to review discovery. Court sets. 

  Hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:10 AM Defendant Joel R Pugh in court with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has discovery but not an offer.  State to provide offer to defense.  Court sets matter for another status date.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

08:23 AM Defendant Joel R Pugh in court with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Tracking 22CF682.

Hearing on June 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:18 AM Defendant Joel R Pugh in court with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for status. 
Defense has received some discovery. Case 22CF682 needs to be set for preliminary hearing. 
State will make a global offer after the preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.

08:47 AM Defendant Joel R Pugh in court with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
The Defendant was taken into custody on an unrelated matter.  Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:40 AM Defendant Joel R Pugh in court with SPD intern, Taylor Olson for attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Charlie Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

09:51 AM Defendant Joel R Pugh in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court takes a short recess at 9:54 AM to allow for the defendant to be evaluated by the Public Defender's Office.  Matter recalled at 10:08 AM with the same appearances.  The defendant stated there no longer was a Representative from the Public Defender's Office available to evaluate him.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
